Trial_Design.evidence: The remaining 60 cases were randomly divided into the traditional group ( n = 30) and the improved group ( n = 30).

Participants.evidence: 72 patients with right subclavian venipuncture catheterization were collected

Intervention.evidence: This study compared the effect of ultrasound-guided subclavian vein puncture with traditional blind puncture

Objective.evidence: Objective: This study compared the effect of ultrasound-guided subclavian vein puncture with traditional blind puncture

Method_Outcome.evidence: We record two sets of ultrasound localization time, puncture time, one-time puncture power, total puncture success rate, and short-term (24-hour) complications.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The remaining 60 cases were randomly divided into the traditional group ( n = 30) and the improved group ( n = 30).

Number_Randomised.evidence: The remaining 60 cases were randomly divided into the traditional group ( n = 30) and the improved group ( n = 30).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Compared with the traditional group, the ultrasound positioning time and puncture time in the improved group were significantly reduced and the puncture success rate was higher.

Harms.evidence: There were no complications, such as incorrect arterial puncture and the occurrence of pneumothorax, in either group.
